document_data.name: House of Tezca
document_data.caption: ''House of Tezca ''
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Tezca''' was a large desert found in south of [[Nexal]] on the continent of [[Maztica]]. It was named after [[Tezca]], the Maztican god of the sun and heat.
document_data.Geography: The House of Tezca was a bleak, barren land of sand and stone. In it could be found [[Sunstone (lake)|Sunstone]] and [[Tewahca]], the City of the Gods. After [[Qotal]]'s return and the flight of many refugees from Nexal, Qotal caused a series of oases to spring up in a line down the middle of the desert, and a larger lake near the center of the desert itself, inside a fertile valley. It was by that lake that Nexalans built a new city, [[Tukan]].
document_data.Inhabitants: The House of Tezca was inhabited only by [[Desert dwarf|desert dwarves]], who lived in small villages cut directly into canyon walls.
document_data.History:
Sometime in the distant past, Tewahca was built, including the massive pyramid upon which [[Zaltec]] and Qotal fought their legendary battle.

At some point, during the reign of Chalco, the Nexalan Empire sent an army across the northern part of the House of Tezca to conquer [[Kolan]]. Later, in the year [[1362|1362 DR]], Qotal caused a series of oases to spring up in a line along the middle of the desert, and a lake in a fertile valley in the center of the desert. Here the Nexala people established Tukan.
